event: Millennium Summit. New York, United Nations.
event_description: Countries commit to the achievement of the MDGs.

event: First International Conference on Financing for Development. Monterrey, México.
event_description: Countries commit to ODA and less developed countries.

event: First High-Level Forum on Aid Harmonization. Rome, Italy.
event1: G77 High-level Conference on South-South Cooperation (BAPA+25). Marrakesch, Morocco.
info: 13th Summit in Santa Cruz, Bolivia. The constitution of SEGIB, in force since 2005, was approved.

event: First United Nations Day for South-South Cooperation
event_description: (December 14th). It is then changed to September 12th.

event: Second High-Level Forum on Aid Effectiveness. Paris, France.
event_description: The Paris Declaration on Aid Effectiveness is adopted.

info: In view of the decline of ODA to LAC and the renewed momentum of SSC and TC, Ibero-American countries ask SEGIB to systematize this new scenario.

First Report on Ibero-American Cooperation. Objective: systematize countries' SSC and TC and contextualize the new framework for ODA; provide visibility and inputs for public policy management. The 17th Summit of Santiago de Chile mandates its annual preparation.

event: Third High-Level Forum on Aid Effectiveness. Accra, Ghana.
event1: Second International Conference on Financing for Development. Doha, Qatar.
event1_description: Follows up on the Monterrey Consensus.
event2: First Biennal High-Level Meeting of the Development Cooperation Forum (DCF-ECOSOC).
info: The Report highlights gaps between countries. The 18th Summit of San Salvador approves the creation of PIFCSS. Objective: strengthen capacities and close gaps.

event: First Biennal High-Level Meeting of the Development Cooperation Forum
event1: High-level Conference on South-South Cooperation (BAPA+30).. Nairobi, Kenya.
info: 1st Edition of the Report in English. A chapter prepared by IB Heads of Cooperation is incorporated, which, in each edition, reflects on a shared vision on SSC and TC and the Global Development Agenda.

PIFCSS begins its activities. More than 3,500 initiatives are systematized in almost 600 pages. New data, indicators and methodologies are defined that broaden the capacity to analize and understand SSC and TC.

event: Fourth High-Level Forum on Aid Effectiveness. Busan, South Korea.
event1_description: The United Nations Office for SSC (UNOSSC) is created, replacing the Special Unit for SSC.
info: At the Busan HLF, IB Heads of Cooperation present a shared position prepared in the framework of PIFCSS. After the earthquake in Haiti, the Report incorporates the analysis of SSC and TC with the non-Ibero-American Caribbean and progressively does the same with other regions. Current aggregated figures: + 1,850 exchanges with + 90 countries of the Global South.

event: Conferencia de las Naciones Unidas sobre el Desarrollo Sostenible (Cumbre “Río+20”), en Rio de Janeiro, Brasil.
info: The Report's database includes more than 5,000 initiatives.

event: First Triangular Cooperation Policy Dialogue. Lisbon, Portugal.
event_description: Periodically organized by the OECD and the Government of Portugal.
info: A continuous process of in-depth thematic studies (Health, Food Security, Biodiversity, etc.) and successive technical collaborations with other intergovernmental organizations, such as PAHO, IICA, OECD, IsdB, among others, begins.

event: First High-Level Meeting of the Global Partnership for Effective Development Cooperation. Mexico City, Mexico.
info: SSC and TC initiatives reach maximum records: + 1,800 in one year. The aggregated analysis of this evolution includes more than 1,100 pages.

event: <a href='https://www.un.org/esa/ffd/ffd3/index.html'>Third International Conference on Financing for Development. Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.
event_description: The Addis Ababa Action Agenda (AAAA) is adopted.
event1: United Nations Sustainable Development Summit. New York, United Nations.
event1_description: The 2030 Agenda and the 17 SDGs are adopted. South-South and Triangular Cooperation are recognized as means of implementation.
info: SIDICSS, the regional online database is launched. It is the only system that allows data uploading and cross-checking. Since then, + 500 professionals of the Agencies and D-GC of the 22 Ibero-American countries have been users.

event: Second High-Level Meeting of the Global Partnership for Effective Development Cooperation. Nairobi, Kenya.
event1: First ECOSOC forum on Financing for Development. New York, United Nations.
info: The methodology that identifies the alignment of SSC and TC initiatives with the SDGs is designed. The foundations are laid for a better understanding of these modalities in the framework of the 2030 Agenda.

event: First meeting of the TOSSD Task Force. Paris, France.
event_description: A metric on the contributions to the SDGs, beyond ODA, is promoted.
event1: Global South-South Development Expo, organized by the United Nations Office for South-South Cooperation. Antalya, Turkey.
info: The 10th edition of the Report is published, completing a decade of the systematization of SSC and TC in Ibero-America. The Report has evolved: from SSC and TC and ODA in Ibero-America, to SSC and TC in Ibero-America with the entire Global South.

event: Tenth Edition of the Global South-South Development Expo. New York, United Nations.
info: The book A decade of SSC in Ibero-America is published: it systematizes + 7,000 initiatives and summarizes SSC's milestones, through the more than 975 events that, since 1955, have set its foundations. It is presented at the New York Expo.

event: 1ª Cumbre de los ODS en Nueva York, NNUU.
event_description: Revisa el progreso de la Agenda 2030.
event1: 2ª Conferencia de las Naciones Unidas sobre CSS (PABA+40) en Buenos Aires, Argentina.
info: More than 100 international presentations of the Report. Ibero-American Summits, South-South Expos and PABA+40 stand out. UNDP develops the First SSC Report in Africa, with technical support from SEGIB.
The word 'Triangular' was added to the title of the Report. SIDICSS has more than 1,400 TC initiatives. The SEGIB-UE project on knowledge generation on TC was launched.
The platform informesursur.org was launched at the 27th Summit of Andorra. It allows digital access to data, graphs, highlights, reports and documents on Ibero-American SSC and TC since 2010.

event: Global South-South Development Expo. Bangkok, Thailand.
event_description: Debate on South-South and Triangular Cooperation and the way out of the COVID-19 crisis.
event1_description: adopts the 17.3.1 indicator which includes SSC's contribution to the SDGs. OCDE (IFT-TOSSD) and UNCTAD are co-custodians.
info: In-depth study shows that the region's SSC and TC could adapt and was responsive to the COVID-19 crisis. The Health sector explained 1 out of 4 exchanges. This edition is illustrated with photos from the Image Bank on SSC and TC developed between PIFCSS and SEGIB, generating visual evidence of this cooperation.

event: Second United Nations SDG Summit. New York, United Nations.
event_description: Half-way to the deadline of the 2030 Agenda.
info: SEGIB deepens its exchanges and technical dialogue with UNCTAD and IFT-TOSSD. The accumulated experience positions SEGIB as a reference in the global debate on SSC measurement. SIDICSS has more than 10,000 initiatives.

event: Summit of the Future. New York, United Nations.
event_description: A Pact for the Future is adopted.
event1_description: which Secretariat is held by the OECD, replaces the Task Force on the new cooperation metrics.
event2: Interregional Expert Meeting on the Measurement of South-South Cooperation. Doha, Qatar.
event2_description: Led by UNCTAD, it brought countries and multilateral agencies from different regions together.
info: The 15th edition of the Report is presented at the 29th Summit of Cuenca (Ecuador). In an unprecedented regional exercise at the global level, more than 2,800 pages of analysis and conceptualization constitute a unique account of the SSC and TC that the 22 Ibero-American countries have been carrying out for almost two decades.

event: Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development.
